definition: to sell/to make or carry out (a plan or intrigue etc)

sentences.english: The Foreign Ministry supports the sale, since it believes it will improve Israeli-Russian relations.
sentences.chinese: 外交部同意該軍售，因爲這會改善俄以關係。

sentences.english: That is the unuttered matter that underlies the ritualistic argument over arms sales.
sentences.chinese: 有個不能說的事就是有個關於軍售的觀點。

sentences.english: In this context they discussed the issue of the EU arms embargo against China.
sentences.chinese: 在此背景下，雙方討論了歐盟對華軍售禁令問題。

sentences.english: America can hardly ignore all this in its arms-sales policies.
sentences.chinese: 美國在其軍售政策中很難忽略這些因素。

sentences.english: First, why does Beijing react with such rhetorical vehemence to the arms sales?
sentences.chinese: 首先，爲什麼軍售引起了北京激烈反應？

sentences.english: Two years later, in deference to China, he agreed to rein in such sales.
sentences.chinese: 兩年後，他卻臣服於中國，同意逐步減少對臺軍售。

sentences.english: The historical background for theban deserves to be examined.
sentences.chinese: 歐盟對華軍售禁令有其歷史背景。

definition: One-China principle, the official doctrine that Taiwan is a province of China
loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)

pinyin: Nuo4 bei4 er3 He2 ping2 jiang3
